author: cipis

title: CR-10 Dial Indicator Holder for a dial indicator with thicker back

description.text:
My dial indicator was to thick for the one remixed by Laurmann.
I needed about 1mm of clearance to make my dial indicator fit.

I have also modified Casters G-code (http://myfordboy.blogspot.se/p/creality-cr-10.html) for running the calibration (designed for my CR-10 mini bed size 300x220) now waiting for user input instead of sleeping a fixed amount of time.

HOT ALIGN G-CODE

M190 S60 ;heat bed to 60C
M104 S195 ;start heating extruder to 195C
M109 S195 ;wait until extruder reaches 195C

G21 ;metric values
M82 ;set extruder to absolute mode
M107 ;set fan off

G91
G1 Z30.0 F9000 ;//clear z
G90 ;absolute positioning

G28 X0 Y0 ;move X/Y to min endstops
G0 F3500 X10.000 Y10.00 ;//move in for paper test
MO Place a piece of paper
M1 Place a piece of paper

G28 Z0 ;//move in for paper test
MO Set nozzle height
M1 Set nozzle height

G1 Z25.0 F9000 ;move bed to clear indicator
G92 E0 ;zero the extruded length
G1 F9000
M107 ;set fan off
;Move DTI to each corner in turn
G0 F3500 X10.000 Y60.00 Z10.000
M117 ;zero DTI
;G4 P10000 ;wait 10 seconds to set DTI to zero
MO Zero indicator
M1 Zero indicator

G1 X290.000 Y220.000
MO Click to continue
M1 Click to continue

G1 X290.000 Y60.000
MO Click to continue
M1 Click to continue

G1 X10.000 Y220.000
MO Click to continue
M1 Click to continue

G1 X10.000 Y60.000 ;return DTI to start position
MO Click to continue
M1 Click to continue

M107 ;set fan off
G0 F9000 Z25
;End GCode
M104 S0 ; set extruder temperature off
M140 S0 ; set bed temperature off
M84 ;disable steppers

COLD ALIGN G-CODE

G21 ;metric values
M82 ;set extruder to absolute mode
M107 ;set fan off

G91
G1 Z30.0 F9000 ;//clear z
G90 ;absolute positioning

G28 X0 Y0 ;move X/Y to min endstops
G0 F3500 X10.000 Y10.00 ;//move in for paper test
MO Place a piece of paper
M1 Place a piece of paper

G28 Z0 ;//move in for paper test
MO Set nozzle height
M1 Set nozzle height

G1 Z30.0 F9000 ;move bed to clear indicator
G92 E0 ;zero the extruded length
G1 F5000

;Move DTI to each corner in turn
G0 F3500 X10.000 Y60.00 Z10.000
M117 ;zero DTI
MO Zero indicator
M1 Zero indicator

G1 X290.000 Y220.000
MO Click to continue
M1 Click to continue

G1 X290.000 Y60.000
MO Click to continue
M1 Click to continue

G1 X10.000 Y220.000
MO Click to continue
M1 Click to continue

G1 X10.000 Y60.000 ;return DTI to start position
MO Click to continue
M1 Click to continue

G0 F9000 Z25
;End GCode
M104 S0 ; set extruder temperature off
M140 S0 ; set bed temperature off
M84 ;disable steppers

Printer:

CR-10 mini

No

Yes

.2

20%

print_settings.Notes:: As there is not much infill the infill percentage will not impact the print speed significantly. You will need some as the top and bottom plates are 2mm thick leaving a tiny bit of air in the middle (unless you go for 5 top/bottom layers, however that is not necessary).

description.text:
Tired of having your propellers fly around in your bag and then when you break one, you just can't find one with the right direction?

This convenient propeller carrying case solves that issue! It is designed specifically for Racerstar 2035 propellers and fits 6 pieces. They are held in place well in two stacks (three of each direction) so that it is easy to pick the right one.

The lid has a snap fit so that it does not fall off in the bag. Just press the base slightly where the snap fits are and the lid comes of easily.

I use these for my Blade Torrent 110 and they are just perfect!

Where to buy the props:
10 Pairs Racerstar 2035 (Affiliate link)
10 Pairs Racerstar 2035 (Non-Affiliate link)

Rafts:

Doesn't Matter

Supports:

No

Resolution:

0.2mm layer height

Infill:

25%

Notes:

You will need to rotate the lid to make it lie on it's back.

As there is not much infill the infill percentage will not impact the print speed significantly. You will need some as the top and bottom plates are 2mm thick leaving a tiny bit of air in the middle (unless you go for 5 top/bottom layers, however that is not necessary).

title: CR-10S Dual Extrusion Motor Mount
license: Creative Commons - Attribution - Non-Commercial - Share Alike

description.text:
This is motor mount for second extruder motor. It mounts to back of right side X-axis bar. I bought original Creality motors from Aliexpress, one for spare and one for this mount:

https://goo.gl/3HJCfk

I will be adding parts and guide to dual extrusion on CR-10S to my collection:

https://www.thingiverse.com/Koplari/collections/cr-10s-dual-extrusion-parts

Printer:

CR-10S

Rafts:

No

Supports:

Yes

Resolution:

0.2

Infill:

20-25

Notes:

Use supports to support large opening near motor axle. I printed with PLA, it can take the weight of the motor.

3 top/bottom/outer layers.

Depending on what extruder you use, mounting bolts have to be at right length. With MK8 extrusion parts, I used 2 x M3x25, 1 x M3x20 and 1 x M3x6 bolts.

Whole thing mounts to 2 original bolts that hold those V-slot rollers. You can mount it to stock nuts, they thread just to hold it all together. Installing little longer bolts may be in order, I will install them for sure.
